channel.title: Internet per hour
channel.description: Apparently, most of the big internet companies are going to try to switch to internet per hour. So like right now, you pay per month and get unlimited. They want to limit it to say 4 hours a day. Has anyone else heard of this or?

item.title: Internet per hour
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Cocao, I beleive your from America so this hopefully wont affect me. The problem with broadband in the UK is that your bandwidth is always capped! I have 40gb allowance a month but If I exceed it you have to pay a ridiculaous amount of money per GB after. Even the services that promote “Unlimited Usage” always have a “fair usage” policy.

My isp gives me unlimited downloads, I just get reduced download speeds for 4 hours if I download too much during “peak” hours, which is pretty reasonable.

Read full topic

item.title: Internet per hour
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:18, topic:273210”][quote author=Creme de la Creme link=topic=360585.msg2747265#msg2747265 date=1239705224]

Cocao, I beleive your from America so this hopefully wont affect me. The problem with broadband in the UK is that your bandwidth is always capped! I have 40gb allowance a month but If I exceed it you have to pay a ridiculaous amount of money per GB after. Even the services that promote “Unlimited Usage” always have a “fair usage” policy.

Haha I’m from the UK and have that fair usage policy but unlimited bandwidth. It’s not that bad… they just lower your speed for a while if you torrent all day long.
[/quote]
Here I live I have not capped speed or bandwidth, and no fair usage policy.
But the Internet is expensive.
50$ for 4000/500 Kb/s.

But what is the reason for paying for each hour?[/quote]
Everything is overpriced here in Norway

Read full topic
